issue.title: [CI] InternalMedianAbsoluteDeviationTests testConcurrentEquals failing

labels.name: medium-risk
labels.description: An open issue or test failure that is a medium risk to future releases

issue.body:
Fails on 8.11 branch, not on main

**Build scan:**
https://gradle-enterprise.elastic.co/s/4irsnbcx5vpfw/tests/:server:test/org.elasticsearch.search.aggregations.metrics.InternalMedianAbsoluteDeviationTests/testConcurrentEquals
**Reproduction line:**
```
./gradlew ':server:test' --tests "org.elasticsearch.search.aggregations.metrics.InternalMedianAbsoluteDeviationTests.testConcurrentEquals" -Dtests.seed=ED3008B8577B78F8 -Dtests.locale=fr-BE -Dtests.timezone=Asia/Kolkata -Druntime.java=21
```

**Applicable branches:**
8.11

**Reproduces locally?:**
Yes

https://gradle-enterprise.elastic.co/scans/tests?tests.container=org.elasticsearch.search.aggregations.metrics.InternalMedianAbsoluteDeviationTests&tests.test=testConcurrentEquals

comment.body: Interesting, I got 1 failure out of a 1000 tries.. Not tied to 8.10 in any way, just a corner case I think.

pull_request.title: [8.10] Backport Exclude desired_nodes validation tests from mixed-cluster QA
pull_request.body:
Backport of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/100682 to 8.10

Closes https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/101419

labels.name: >test
labels.description: Issues or PRs that are addressing/adding tests

labels.name: :Distributed/Distributed
labels.description: A catch all label for anything in the Distributed Area. If you aren't sure, use this one.

repo.name: elasticsearch
repo.description: Free and Open, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine

repo.name: elasticsearch
repo.description: Free and Open, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,24 @@ restResources {
   }
 }
 
+def excludeList = []
+
+// These tests check setting validations in the desired_node API.
+// Validation (and associated tests) are supposed to be skipped/have
+// different behaviour for versions before and after 8.10 but mixed
+// cluster tests may not respect that.
+// The qa cluster consists of 4 nodes. Two nodes are on old version and the
+// other two nodes on the current version. The node selector skips
+// the nodes on current version. The rest client then round robins
+// between the two nodes on old version. In order to unmute this,
+// we need a different node selector, that always consistently
+// selects the same node.
comment.body: Oh nevermind, this is to exclude the tests entirely.

issue.title: Abstract node features to allow a smooth transition from Version to Features
issue.body:
Context: I started working on this class as part of NodeInfo Version-related refactoring, trying to isolate Version.fromString and why is it needed.

The idea is to move any version check to a capability check, each expressed as a boolean method on a `ESRestTestNodesFeatures` interface. The interface now is implemented with Version checks, but those can be moved (at once or progressively) to feature-based checks once we have them exposed via a rest API or some other method available in rest tests (where we do not have direct access to FeatureService).

Also, it allows us to do the refactoring in 2 steps: change the code structure but keep it essentially the same (this PR) + in the future do a change to one single point - reducing risk to introduce errors.

A very similar change will be required on [AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/a545fe2f141be7dc38c6df21f0087cffa7fc87ff/x-pack/qa/rolling-upgrade/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/upgrades/AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java#L26) - that would be the subject of following PR.

comment.body: I still think that doing this separately to cluster features is going to lead to confusion for devs (there's two types of features? they do the same thing? eh?), and doing something based on historical features (when that's in) would be more obvious - rather than adding this in now, then modifying it in a week or two to change it to use historical features.
The Pattern should probably be pulled out into a static field so it can be reused

comment.body: We don't want this to be a concrete type, maybe even unmodifiable & hidden behind a method

pull_request.title: Abstract node features to allow a smooth transition from Version to Features
pull_request.body:
Context: I started working on this class as part of NodeInfo Version-related refactoring, trying to isolate Version.fromString and why is it needed.

The idea is to move any version check to a capability check, each expressed as a boolean method on a `ESRestTestNodesFeatures` interface. The interface now is implemented with Version checks, but those can be moved (at once or progressively) to feature-based checks once we have them exposed via a rest API or some other method available in rest tests (where we do not have direct access to FeatureService).

Also, it allows us to do the refactoring in 2 steps: change the code structure but keep it essentially the same (this PR) + in the future do a change to one single point - reducing risk to introduce errors.

A very similar change will be required on [AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/a545fe2f141be7dc38c6df21f0087cffa7fc87ff/x-pack/qa/rolling-upgrade/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/upgrades/AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java#L26) - that would be the subject of following PR.

comment.body:
What if by fluke a weight turned out to be an exact integer? Would HuggingFace print that with a decimal point? If not then that might come through as an integer, so maybe that case should be handled too. (And just cast it to a `float` after parsing.)

Maybe all cases could be combined by just using `parser.numberValue().floatValue()`?

pull_request.title: [ML] Hugging Face inference service
pull_request.body:
Inference service implementation for hugging face.

## Notable changes
- Implements the service and http components to interact with the elser hugging face endpoint
- Allows the task settings to be optional for services (since this service won't have any at the moment)
- Temporarily get around the sender initialization issue by constructing the sender in `start()` and `infer()` calls

There are various improvements for testing in this PR: https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/101246 which will be a follow up.

## Other TODOs
- Still need to determine if the results were truncated. My guess is the hugging face API will need to communicate that to us 🤷‍♂️ 

## Testing
Add the service

```
PUT _inference/sparse_embedding/test
{
    "service": "hugging_face_elser",
    "service_settings": {
        "url": "<hugging face url>",
        "api_key": "<api key>"
    }
}
```

Perform inference
```
POST _inference/sparse_embedding/test
{
    "input": "The answer to the universe is"
}
```

labels.name: Team:ML
labels.description: Meta label for the ML team

repo.description: Free and Open, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine

repo.name: elasticsearch
repo.description: Free and Open, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine

comment.body:
Add a test with a truncated document and confirm that the resulting parse exception gets handled nicely. I.e. no closing brace after one of the token/weight objects, and the text representation just ends there.

If a document is valid in terms of matching brackets and braces but is missing some tokens then there'll be no way to detect that. We'll have to trust that the code on the HuggingFace side doesn't do that.

comment.body:
This should probably be throttled to some extent. If something causes _every_ response from HuggingFace to be unparseable then this will fill the log files very quickly.

Maybe log the first 10 messages per client then once per hour or something like that.

comment.body:
There's a problem here because `taskSettings` might be `null`.

If the execution flow can get here you'll have to write a `TaskSettings` derivative that older nodes understand.

Another option is not to serialize a `ModelConfigurations` object at all if the older node won't understand it.

In this situation it wouldn't hurt to serialise a `ElserMlNodeTaskSettings` object because it currently contains no settings.

comment.body: This failure is on a cluster state update, switching to distributed
Actually, I'm not sure using booleans gives us much here, there's only going to be O(tens) of features, so a simpler more direct representation is probably better here.

pull_request.title: Abstract node features to allow a smooth transition from Version to Features
pull_request.body:
Context: I started working on this class as part of NodeInfo Version-related refactoring, trying to isolate Version.fromString and why is it needed.

The idea is to move any version check to a capability check, each expressed as a boolean method on a `ESRestTestNodesFeatures` interface. The interface now is implemented with Version checks, but those can be moved (at once or progressively) to feature-based checks once we have them exposed via a rest API or some other method available in rest tests (where we do not have direct access to FeatureService).

Also, it allows us to do the refactoring in 2 steps: change the code structure but keep it essentially the same (this PR) + in the future do a change to one single point - reducing risk to introduce errors.

A very similar change will be required on [AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/a545fe2f141be7dc38c6df21f0087cffa7fc87ff/x-pack/qa/rolling-upgrade/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/upgrades/AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java#L26) - that would be the subject of following PR.

pull_request.title: Pass shard's primary term to Engine#addSegmentGenerationListener
pull_request.body:
So the engine can check that generation listeners are called on the same primary term.

comment.body: `Map<Version, Set<String>>` might be a better representation. Or reverse it, `Map<String, Version>`

pull_request.title: Abstract node features to allow a smooth transition from Version to Features
pull_request.body:
Context: I started working on this class as part of NodeInfo Version-related refactoring, trying to isolate Version.fromString and why is it needed.

The idea is to move any version check to a capability check, each expressed as a boolean method on a `ESRestTestNodesFeatures` interface. The interface now is implemented with Version checks, but those can be moved (at once or progressively) to feature-based checks once we have them exposed via a rest API or some other method available in rest tests (where we do not have direct access to FeatureService).

Also, it allows us to do the refactoring in 2 steps: change the code structure but keep it essentially the same (this PR) + in the future do a change to one single point - reducing risk to introduce errors.

A very similar change will be required on [AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/a545fe2f141be7dc38c6df21f0087cffa7fc87ff/x-pack/qa/rolling-upgrade/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/upgrades/AbstractUpgradeTestCase.java#L26) - that would be the subject of following PR.
